Root forsythia after the bush has finished blooming and all of its flowers have fallen off. Grow forsythia in well-drained, acidic soil and lots of shade. Try an alternative method for rooting clippings by bending a branch down from an existing bush, covering the first 6 inches (15.2 cm) of the branch with soil and mulch, and using a brick or rock to weigh it down.
